content.rendered:
What is a Construction Manager?

Construction Managers supervise and organize construction projects.

Where does a Construction Manager work?

  • Freelance
  • Trade contacting companies
  • Construction companies

How much does a Construction Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Construction Manager is $64,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Construction Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Architecture majors
  • Engineering majors
Search relevant jobs

Construction Manager skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Construction Managers succeed in their work:

  • Knowledge of technical construction methods
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Analytical skills

What are some common questions about Construction Managers?

Q: How long does it take to become a Construction Manager?

A: 6-8 years.
